author: Max Colchester
title: Europe’s Latest Fix for Its Banks: Opaque Trades
text:
A European government-controlled fund is delving deeper into opaque trades that could potentially expose taxpayers to bank losses—something post-financial crisis rules were meant to protect against.
The European Investment Fund, controlled by European governments and a handful of big banks, is pushing into a fast-growing niche market in which banks pay a fee to investors to cover potential losses on loans.
The...
